page.title: 08LAW AND ORDER CRIME POLICE
page.content: There are few serious crimes in this area.Burglary and theft are the most common crimes,amounting to 30 or 40 cases a year.Money is most commonly stolen and small objects,such as jewellery and silver,which cannot be traced easily.Although the crime figures are consistent throughout the year,there is usually an increase during the Christmas period,when gangs of three to four criminals, often from as far afield as London,burgle houses in the area.Crimes of violence are virtually unknown,although some people who have served prison sentences for violence live in the area.The constable who lives in Tunstall police house also patrols Rodmersham and Highsted.Most police time is spent dealing with occasional road accidents,especially in winter when the narrow country roads are icy.
